z -> P x z) -> forall l l0 : list (Term A n), reduceplus Q l l0 -> P l l0 plusA : A -> A -> A Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) x, y, z : list (Term A n) H1 : reduceplus Q x y H3 : reduceplus Q y z H0 : olist (A:=A) ltM x H4 : nZterm A0 eqA (n:=n) x M1_min : forall x : mon n, ltM x (zero_mon n) -> False ltM_nonrefl : forall x : mon n, ltM x x -> False ltM_trans : transitive (mon n) ltM ltM_wf : b d -> eqA (multA a b) (multA c d) multA_assoc : forall a b c : A, eqA (multA a (multA b c)) (multA (multA a b) c) multA_com : forall a b : A, eqA (multA a b) (multA b a) multA_dist_l : forall a b c : chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (x y z : list (Term A n)), reduceplus Q x y -> canonical A0 eqA ltM x -> reduceplus Q y z -> reduceplus Q x z

Premises:
Inductive mon : nat -> Set := n_0 : mon 0 | c_n : forall d : nat, nat -> mon d -> mon (S d) Arguments mon _%nat_scope Arguments c_n (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive reduceplus (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) : list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> Prop := Rstar_0 : forall x y : list (Term A n), eqP A eqA n x y -> reduceplus Q x y | Rstar_n : forall x y z : list (Term A n), reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q x y -> reduceplus Q y z -> reduceplus Q x z Arguments reduceplus (_ _ _)%list_scope Arguments Rstar_0 (_ _ _)%list_scope Arguments Rstar_n (_ _ _ _)%list_scope
Record Q : Set := Qmake { Qnum : BinNums.Z; Qden : BinNums.positive } Arguments QArith_base.Qmake _%Z_scope _%positive_scope
canonical : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, (mon n -> mon n -> Prop) -> list (Term A n) -> Prop
mult_mon : forall d : nat, mon d -> mon d -> mon d
CoefStructure : forall (A : Set) (A0 : A), A -> forall eqA : A -> A -> Prop, (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> A) -> (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> A -> A) -> (A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A) -> Prop
OrderStructure : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> (A -> A -> A) -> Prop
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
poly : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, (mon n -> mon n -> Prop) -> Set
zero_mon : forall d : nat, mon d
Rstar_n : forall (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (x y z : list (Term A n)), reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q x y -> reduceplus Q y z -> reduceplus Q x z
reduceplus_sind : forall (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (P : list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> SProp), (forall x y : list (Term A n), eqP A eqA n x y -> P x y) -> (forall x y z : list (Term A n), reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q x y -> reduceplus Q y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall l l0 : list (Term A n), reduceplus Q l l0 -> P l l0
reduceplus_ind : forall (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (P : list (Term A n) -> list (Term A n) -> Prop), (forall x y : list (Term A n), eqP A eqA n x y -> P x y) -> (forall x y z : list (Term A n), reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q x y -> reduceplus Q y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall l l0 : list (Term A n), reduceplus Q l l0 -> P l l0
reduce_inv2 : forall (A : Set) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA ->...-> exists (x : list (Term A n)) (a : Term A n), ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) a /\ inPolySet A A0 eqA n ltM x Q /\ canonical A0 eqA ltM x /\ eqP A eqA n q (minuspf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec p (mults multA (n:=n) a x))
Rstar_0 : forall (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (x y : list (Term A n)), eqP A eqA n x y -> reduceplus Q x y
reduce_in_pO : forall (A : Set) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA ->...-> reduce A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q p (pO A n)
irreducible_eqp_com : forall (A : Set) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA ->...-> irreducible A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec Q q

canonical_minuspf : forall (A : Set) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A), CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA ->...-> canonical A0 eqA ltM (minuspf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec l1 l2)

```coq
intros Q x y z H1 H2 H3.
apply reduceplus_ind with (P := fun x y => reduceplus Q x y).
- intros x y Heq. apply Rstar_0. assumption.
- intros x y z H4 H5 H6. apply Rstar_n. assumption. assumption. assumption.
- assumption.
Qed.

original: intros Q x y z H1 H2 H3. apply reduceplus_ind with (P := fun x y => reduceplus Q x y). - intros x y Heq. apply Rstar_0. auto. - intros x y z H4 H5 H6. apply Rstar_n. auto. auto. auto. - auto.
